alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches; Santa Barbara County Inland Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range; Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range; Santa Ynez Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 10:16PM PST until January 09 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM PST MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following areas, Cuyama Valley, Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches, Santa Barbara County Inland Central Coast, Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains, Santa Barbara County Southeastern Coast, Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast, Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range, Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range and Santa Ynez Valley. * WHEN...From 7 AM PST Monday through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A strong Pacific storm system will bring periods of widespread heavy rainfall with rates between one half and one inch per hour, and possibly higher rates near thunderstorms and favored foothill locations. Rainfall totals of 2 to 5 inches will be common over urban areas, with 5 to 10 inches expected in the mountains and foothills, especially over the Santa Ynez and San Rafael mountains. Isolated amounts of 12 inches are possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
